title: WNBA Finals Game 3 takeaways: How Aces beat Mercury to go up 3-0
content: Everything that happened in Game 3, including A'ja Wilson's historic night and Satou Sabally's injury.

title: Yankees left in disbelief: 'Didn't finish the goal'
content: The Yankees believed this team was more talented and more complete than the club that went to the World Series a year ago, but they saw their season end Wednesday night in the ALDS.

title: Schwarber's 2 blasts revive Phils in must-win G3
content: Kyle Schwarber snapped an 0-for-8 skid in the NLDS with two homers Wednesday night, helping the Phillies avoid a sweep with an 8-2 win over the Dodgers in Game 3.

title: Kershaw roughed up in relief in 'hard to watch' 8th
content: Clayton Kershaw's first relief appearance since 2019 wasn't pretty, as he allowed four runs in a nightmarish eighth inning in the Phillies' 8-2 Game 3 victory.

title: Wilson rewards Aces' trust with last-second winner
content: A'ja Wilson made a turnaround jumper with 0.3 seconds left, capping a stellar 34-point night and lifting the Aces over the Mercury 90-88 on Wednesday for a 3-0 lead in the WNBA Finals.

title: UNC backs Belichick as talk swirls amid 2-3 start
content: Amid a chaotic week, North Carolina and head coach Bill Belichick released a joint statement Wednesday night, with the Tar Heels saying he has "the full support" of the UNC administration.

title: Jaguars get Newsome, Campbell goes to Browns
content: The Jaguars and Browns agreed to a trade of cornerbacks Wednesday night, with Greg Newsome heading to Jacksonville and Tyson Campbell going to Cleveland.

title: 'Fail Mary' backlash still hurts Bears' Stevenson
content: Bears cornerback Tyrique Stevenson says the backlash he received for his role in tipping a Hail Mary pass against the Commanders last season "still hurts."

title: 😡 Bottom 10: Not-So-Happy Valley these days
content: Another loss by Penn State put the Nittany Lions -- and the Bottom 10 committee -- in a bit of a predicament.

title: Barnwell sizes up five rookie RBs: Could Croskey-Merritt see more work? Can the Raiders help Jeanty?
content: The rookie RB class could end up being elite. Let's look closer at Ashton Jeanty, Quinshon Judkins, Omarion Hampton, Jacory Croskey-Merritt and Cam Skattebo.

title: Stories of Skattebo: 'What you want me to do, tell him to be quiet?'
content: The energetic Cam Skattebo has added a new element to the Giants, who face the Eagles Thursday night.

title: Wemby, Luka, Ant? Examining the players primed to become the face of the NBA
content: ESPN analyst Zach Kram explores the paths and players who could follow in Curry and James' footsteps.

title: Kung Fu, meditation and a 'Dream Shake': Inside Victor Wembanyama's return
content: A 'traumatic experience' with deep vein thrombosis prompted a summer of exploration for the Spurs star.

title: WWE Crown Jewel preview: Rollins-Rhodes, Cena tour stop, more
content: As WWE Crown Jewel heads to Perth, Western Australia, we break down the biggest storylines, including John Cena's retirement tour.

title: Stephanie 'La Primera' Vaquer's WWE career marked by historic firsts
content: Vaquer shares her path to WWE, and how a memorable night in Indy helped her fulfill "the dream of my life."

title: Let's rank the best NFL divisions this season: Could all four NFC North teams go to the playoffs?
content: Can any division match the NFC North? How do QB injuries impact the AFC North's standing? And which division lands at the bottom of our list?

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 6
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Should you move on from Jameson Williams, A.J. Brown or other disappointing picks?
content: Matt Bowen discusses eight players who have fallen short of expectations early on, and how to value them.

title: Saquon gets realistic about his production: 'Every year is not going to be like how I had it last year'
content: Now in his eighth NFL season, Barkley is working against the odds on multiple fronts when it comes to running back production.

title: Wyshynski predicts every NHL team's finish in 2025-26
content: As the season begins, we reveal which teams will make the Stanley Cup Final, the playoffs and the draft lottery.

title: How the Ducks are building a new Western power
content: After patiently developing a collection of impressive young talent, the ingredients are now there to contend.

title: The race to be No. 9: Which strikers will the USMNT take to the World Cup?
content: The USMNT's history of productive strikers is limited, but ahead of the World Cup, several are in the form of their lives. So who will make the team?

title: The best teams in Europe right now: Bayern, Kane setting the tone
content: Bayern Munich's start to the season has been astonishingly good, but where does the rest of Europe fall in Bill Connelly's rankings?

title: No gap year here: How the Celtics and Pacers approach a season without their leaders
content: Despite injuries to Tyrese Haliburton and Jayson Tatum, the Pacers and Celtics are still approaching the 2025-26 season as win now.

title: Win projections for all 30 NBA teams: How we see the East, West playing out
content: ESPN NBA analyst Kevin Pelton unveils his annual win projections for all 30 teams. Where does your team land?

title: 'I have not been back yet': Why Georgia fans haven't forgiven Auburn 39 years later
content: In 1986, Auburn sprayed hoses at Bulldogs fans, including current QB Gunner Stockton's grandfather, and they haven't forgotten it.

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in, who's out, who has work to do in each league﻿
content: Putting the spotlight on select teams and questions around others as the early playoff picture takes shape.

title: Early 2026 boys' class rankings: The surprise SEC team on top
content: With only one top-10 player committed, some surprising programs have emerged with the strongest classes so far.

title: How six fighters could test Terence Crawford's boxing skills
content: After a dominating win over Canelo Alvarez, forget about a rematch. Here are six fights for Terence Crawford to enhance his legacy.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United turn to Bellingham
content: Manchester United are keeping close tabs on the situation of midfielder Jobe Bellingham at Borussia Dortmund. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: College football best bets for Week 7: Why an 0-5 team should be on your bet slip
content: Pamela Maldonado breaks down her favorite bets for Week 7 of the college football season, including what makes UMass-Kent State a solid game to bet.

title: Survivor pool strategy: Packers, Broncos among top options in Week 6
content: Predictions and picks for ESPN Eliminator Challenge Week 6, including teams to pick or save for later.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Nobel claim: Sorry Trump, even AI isn't buying it
content: AI chatbots, including ChatGPT, Gemini, and Grok, have largely dismissed Donald Trump's claim of deserving a Nobel Peace Prize for ending seven wars. Experts and the AI models found his assertions disputed, vague, or exaggerated, highlighting a lack of solid evidence for truly ending conflicts. While acknowledging some de-escalatory efforts, they deem them insufficient for the prestigious award.

title: Inside Coldrif plant: Rusty equipment among 364 violations; deadly lapses exposed
content: Madhya Pradesh police arrested Sresan Pharmaceuticals owner G Ranganathan, 73, in Chennai after his cough syrup, Coldrif, was linked to 21 child deaths due to toxic chemicals. The company, despite operating with numerous violations for years, is now under national scrutiny, with its manufacturing unit sealed.

title: Google changes work policy: ‘Work From Anywhere’ can’t be used for WFH; sends memo
content: Google is reportedly tightening its "Work from Anywhere" policy, now counting any day worked remotely outside the office as a full week. This change, intended to prevent WFA from substituting regular hybrid work, has drawn criticism from employees for its confusing implementation and restrictions.

title: Investing in PPF? Don’t exceed Rs 1.5L limit; interest on excess will be taken back!
content: New rules now link PPF investments to PAN, making it impossible to hide multiple accounts. Exceeding the Rs 1.5 lakh annual limit can lead to interest clawback on excess contributions.  Irregular accounts won't earn interest, with minor accounts earning a mere 4% until regularized.

title: Nobel Prize in Literature: Hungarian author wins for 'visionary' work amid 'apocalyptic terror'
content: László Krasznahorkai has been awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature 2025 for his compelling and visionary oeuvre. The Swedish Academy announced the prestigious award on Thursday. This year's literature prize joins announcements for Chemistry, Physics, and Medicine, recognizing significant scientific and artistic achievements.

title: China to India: 'Promise' that rare earth magnets supplied will not be re-exported to US
content: China has tightened rare earth export controls, restricting processing technology and targeting defense and semiconductor users. Beijing is reportedly seeking guarantees from India that its heavy rare earth magnets will not be re-exported to the US, aiming to use these controls as a bargaining chip in trade talks.

title: Prithvi Shaw: From child prodigy to career marred by controversies - Full timeline
content: Prithvi Shaw scored 181 in a practice match. The innings saw a heated argument with a teammate. This incident adds to Shaw's past controversies. Fitness concerns have also affected his career. He was not picked in the IPL 2025 auction. Shaw has moved to Maharashtra for a fresh start.

title: What fear does to your brain and body
content: When startled, your brain and body activate the fight-or-flight response, flooding you with stress hormones. This rapid reaction, coordinated by the amygdala and hypothalamus, quickens breathing, raises heart rate, and sharpens senses for survival. While essential, chronic activation can harm health, but managing fear through mindfulness, exercise, and support is possible.

title: 11 AI prompts for Karwa Chauth 2025 couples to celebrate love and rituals
content: Karwa Chauth 2025 is embracing a digital revolution, with couples using Gemini Nano's Banana AI to create personalized, visually stunning images of their celebrations. This technology transforms descriptive words into romantic moonlit moments and cinematic portraits, allowing couples to capture and preserve their special memories with creativity and a modern twist.

title: IND vs SA: Smriti Mandhana shatters record! Closes in on 5000 runs
content: Smriti Mandhana has become the highest run-getter in women's ODIs in a single calendar year, surpassing Belinda Clark's 28-year-old record. She achieved this milestone during India's World Cup clash against South Africa, amassing 982 runs in 17 matches this year. Mandhana's exceptional form continues to redefine consistency in women's ODI cricket.

title: 1st in India! K'taka approves 12 menstrual leaves a year; what policy says
content: Karnataka has become India's first state to approve menstrual leave for women, allowing up to 12 sanctioned leaves annually. State minister Santosh Lad announced the progressive law, emphasizing its welfare-oriented approach for women. The decision marks a significant step for women's rights in the state.

title: India-UK CEO Forum: PM Modi, Starmer chart 'roadmap for shared progress'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and UK PM Keir Starmer addressed the India-UK CEO Forum, highlighting the Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA) and its potential to double bilateral trade to $112 billion by 2030. The leaders emphasized CETA's role in enhancing market access, strengthening MSMEs, and fostering collaboration in commerce, education, technology, and aspirations, building on existing strong economic ties.

title: IPS officer 'suicide' case: Wife claims husband faced 'years of humiliation'; mystery note in focus
content: Wife of deceased IPS officer Y Puran Kumar, IAS officer Amneet P Kumar, has lodged a complaint seeking FIR against Haryana DGP Shatrujeet Singh Kapur and Rohtak SP Narendra Bijarnia for abetment to suicide and SC/ST Act violations. She alleges her husband faced systematic persecution and humiliation due to his caste, pushing him to suicide.

title: Crippled by Op Sindoor, JeM forms women's wing; who will lead unit?
content: Pakistan-based terror group Jaish-e-Mohammed has launched its first women's wing, 'Jamaat-ul-Mominaat,' led by Maulana Masood Azhar's sister. Recruitment targets wives of commanders and vulnerable women. This strategic shift, possibly prompted by recent attacks and Indian Army operations, signals a potential move towards training female suicide attackers, aligning JeM with other groups that have utilized women in combat roles.

title: Was Ashwin 'forced' into retirement by Rohit, Gautam Gambhir?
content: Ravichandran Ashwin clarified his retirement from cricket was a personal choice, not influenced by selectors or teammates, despite advice to reconsider. He emphasized the need for clear communication between senior players like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli and team management regarding their future roles and the 2027 World Cup.

title: Boost for Indian students: UK to open 9 university campuses in India
content: India and the United Kingdom are strengthening their educational partnership. Nine British universities will soon open campuses in India. This collaboration aims to provide high-quality higher education. It is expected to create thousands of skilled jobs. This move signifies a major expansion in bilateral education cooperation. Both nations anticipate significant growth and enhanced opportunities.

title: Korean singer Yoon Ji-ah killed by fan who once donated $70K
content: South Korean TikToker Yoon Ji-ah, with over 300,000 fans, was found dead on a mountain after her last livestream. Her death, caused by suffocation from neck compression, was inflicted by a fan who had developed an obsession and financial troubles. The incident highlights the dangers of fan communities and influencer security.

title: 'Thank You’ turns ugly! Shaw faces inquiry; Vengsarkar to lead probe
content: Cricket authorities are investigating an incident where Prithvi Shaw swung his bat at Musheer Khan. The confrontation happened after Shaw's dismissal in a practice match. Both Mumbai and Maharashtra cricket associations are gathering reports. Dilip Vengsarkar will oversee the probe. Player discipline is a key focus for the associations.

title: Watch: Celebrations erupt in Khan Yunis after Trump's Gaza peace deal
content: Gaza streets erupted in celebration as President Trump announced a peace deal between Israel and Hamas, bringing an end to the war. Residents expressed immense joy and gratitude for the cessation of bloodshed. Families of hostages shared overwhelming happiness as their loved ones are set to return home.

title: 'Gauti bhai said…': Surya opens up on how Samson’s role changed in Asia Cup
content: Suryakumar Yadav lauded Sanju Samson's resilience amidst selection doubts, highlighting his crucial role in India's Asia Cup triumph. Samson, who embraced a changed batting position, proved his impact and was later recognized with the CEAT T20 Batter of the Year award. He expressed his dedication to the Indian team, willing to bat anywhere and contribute in any role.

title: Riyadh Air to launch its 1st London flights on Oct 26, but tickets won’t be open to public
content: Riyadh Air, Saudi Arabia’s new national carrier, begins its first international route to London Heathrow on October 26 using a leased 787-9. Initial flights are limited to staff and affiliates as part of an operational trial phase. Public ticket sales will open later, following delivery of the airline’s own aircraft and final readiness evaluations.

title: Discounts double! India to step up Russia oil imports; increase despite Trump pressure
content: Indian refiners are eyeing more Russian crude imports as price discounts widen, despite ongoing US discussions.  October arrivals are set to increase, with potential for further growth.  While the US has pressured India to curb these purchases, New Delhi maintains its price-driven strategy.

title: Gill speaks about taking over ODI captaincy from Rohit for the first time
content: Shubman Gill, set to captain India in ODIs against Australia, aims to emulate Rohit Sharma's calm leadership and team unity.  The young skipper emphasised the crucial role of veterans Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli in the upcoming series. Gill also highlighted his positive rapport with coach Gautam Gambhir, focusing on player security and fast bowler development.

title: 'They'll find a reason ... ': Trump on Nobel chances
content: The White House hailed President Trump as 'The Peace President' ahead of the Nobel Peace Prize announcement, a move seen as projecting his candidacy. Trump himself claimed credit for settling numerous conflicts, including a peace deal between India and Pakistan, though India has refuted foreign interference in its operations. Several nations have previously nominated him for the prestigious award.

title: Actor attacked by dog during street play on stray menace in Kerala
content: A solo artist performing a street play about stray dog attacks in Kannur was bitten by a stray dog that climbed onto the stage. The incident occurred during a scene depicting a dog attack, leading some audience members to initially believe it was part of the performance. The artist later informed organizers and sought medical treatment.

title: Manipur alert: 9-foot rocket weighing 200kg recovered in Churachandpur
content: Security forces in Churachandpur district unearthed a substantial 9-foot-long country-made rocket, packed with 200kg of explosives and a detonator. This discovery echoes past rocket attacks by Kuki militants, including a fatal incident last September.  Four similar rockets were also found in the region last November, highlighting ongoing security concerns.

title: UP: Private jet crashes in Farrukhabad; lost control during take off
content: A private plane experienced a loss of control during takeoff in Farrukhabad, subsequently crashing into nearby bushes. Officials confirmed that both pilots and any passengers aboard emerged unharmed from the incident. Visuals from the scene indicate surprisingly minor damage to the aircraft, with its wings and propeller appearing intact, though the front of the jet is noticeably angled downwards.

title: ‘Everyone loves Israel again’: Trump speaks to Netanyahu on phone
content: President Trump revealed his conversation with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu following a Gaza ceasefire and hostage release agreement. Trump attributed the success to a combination of circumstances, luck, and the efforts of his administration and international partners, calling it a historic step towards lasting peace.

title: When is Diwali? Schools to remain closed for 5 days including Dhanteras and Bhai Dooj
content: Diwali school holidays in 2025 will span five days from October 18 to October 23, covering Dhanteras, Narak Chaturdashi, Chhoti Diwali, Diwali, Govardhan Puja and Bhai Dooj. Schools across several states will remain closed during this festive period, providing students an extended break. Parents should check with their child’s school as holiday dates may differ by region and management. This long festive break allows families to celebrate traditional events and spend quality time together.

title: Rajvir Jawanda funeral: Son lights pyre; CM Bhagwant Mann, several Punjabi artists attend last rites
content: Punjabi singer-actor Rajvir Jawanda was laid to rest today in his native village, Paon, Ludhiana, at the age of 35. He passed away due to multiple organ failure following a bike accident. Several Punjabi celebrities and Punjab's Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann attended the funeral to pay their respects.

title: 'Natural partners': PM Modi hails India-UK trade deal; job & other benefits
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded the India-UK Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), stating it will reduce import costs, create jobs, and boost trade for industries and consumers. UK PM Keir Starmer echoed this sentiment, calling the pact a "breakthrough moment" that will drive growth and enhance life in both nations.

title: Zubeen Garg death: Footage of arrested trio to be deleted from singer's last film
content: Director Rajesh Bhuyan announced the removal of footage featuring individuals arrested in connection with Zubeen Garg's death from his final film, 'Roi Roi Binale.' This decision follows public backlash over the appearance of Zubeen's bandmate Shekhar Jyoti Goswami and others in the film's promotional song. The director stated that nothing displeasing to the public would be included in Zubeen's film.

title: 'Burned while asleep': South Delhi man attacked with hot oil and chilli powder by wife
content: A shocking incident unfolded in South Delhi's Madangir where a woman allegedly doused her sleeping husband with hot oil and chilli powder. The 28-year-old man sustained burn injuries and is undergoing treatment. Police have registered a case under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code, and an investigation is ongoing into the disturbing domestic dispute.

title: 'Bollywood ko Britain le jayenge': Starmer announces 3 big YRF productions in UK
content: Bollywood giant Yash Raj Films is set to film three major productions in the UK starting early 2026, a significant boost for UK-India creative ties. UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer announced this during his Mumbai visit, highlighting the expected creation of over 3,000 jobs and substantial economic benefits for Britain. This collaboration follows a recent landmark trade deal.

title: London is equally horrible': Why only crib about Bengaluru traffic, asks DK Shivakumar
content: Bengaluru's traffic gets more attention than other cities due to media freedom, Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar stated. He highlighted the city's population surge and the challenges of managing traffic, garbage, and water. Shivakumar urged stronger civic responsibility, noting that indifference and illegal dumping hinder progress. New administrative structures aim for better governance.

title: Land Rover Defender goes on rampage: SUV rams into 5 cars near Noida mall
content: A speeding Land Rover Defender caused a multi-vehicle collision near Gulshan Mall trisection in Noida on Tuesday night, impacting five cars and a motorcycle. Fortunately, no serious injuries were reported. The driver, identified as Sunit from Sector 100, lost control at the busy intersection. Police took the driver into custody and are investigating potential intoxication.

title: No surprise: 12 pedestrians die every week in Delhi
content: The Supreme Court's order to prioritize pedestrians highlights Delhi's dangerous streets, where footpaths are encroached and vehicles dominate. Despite efforts, pedestrian safety remains a critical issue, with thousands injured or killed annually. The city's infrastructure is largely vehicle-centric, forcing pedestrians and cyclists into hazardous situations.

title: Cough syrup deaths: Licence of Sresan Pharmaceuticals, makers of Coldrif, cancelled
content: Tamil Nadu health minister confirmed the permanent revocation of Sresan Pharmaceuticals' license, maker of Coldrif cough syrup, following the deaths of at least 21 children in Madhya Pradesh. The company's owner has been arrested, and its manufacturing facility, found with serious safety lapses, has been sealed.

title: 364 Violations Found At Pharma Company Behind 'Killer' Cough Syrup: Sources
content: The pharmaceutical company, Sresan Pharma, at the centre of the cough syrup tragedy that has claimed over a dozen children's lives in Madhya Pradesh was found to be supplying the cough syrup without testing it, said a top source.

title: Taiwanese Man Seeks Rs 1 Crore Compensation From Wife's Lover
content: A Taiwanese man has moved court against his wife's lover and demanded approximately Rs 1 crore as compensation.

title: From Maths To Bihar's Poll Arithmetic, Professor KC Sinha Set For A Fresh Exam
content: During his four-decade journey as a mathematician, Professor KC Sinha authored about 70 books that helped generations of students make sense of numbers

title: Punjab Police Busts Babbar Khalsa Terror Module, 2 Arrested From Jalandhar
content: Punjab Police on Thursday claimed to have busted a Babbar Khalsa International terror module with the arrest of two persons from Jalandhar, and seized an RDX-fitted improvised explosive device along with a remote control.

title: 2 Injured As Porsche Car Racing BMW Crashes On Highway In Mumbai: Cops
content: A speeding Porsche car crashed into a road divider, injuring its two occupants, while apparently racing another high-end vehicle on a highway in Mumbai early on Thursday, police said.

title: PM Modi Raises Khalistani Extremism Issue In Meet With Keir Starmer
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today held wide-ranging talks with his British counterpart Keir Starmer, broadly focusing on boosting the India-UK ties in areas of trade, defence and security and critical technology.

title: Hungarian Author Laszlo Krasznahorkai Wins Nobel Prize For Literature 2025
content: Hungarian author Laszlo Krasznahorkai has been awarded the Nobel Prize for Literature 2025"for his compelling and visionary oeuvre that, in the midst of apocalyptic terror, reaffirms the power of art."

title: Man Stabs 22-Year-Old Over Loan Repayment Of Rs 5,000 In Delhi: Cops
content: A 22-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly stabbing another man over a loan repayment of Rs 5,000 in Delhi's Rohini, police said.

title: Karnataka Cabinet Okays 1 Paid Menstrual Leave A Month
content: Women employees in Karnataka will get one paid menstrual leave per month, the state cabinet said today.

title: In UK Prime Minister's India Visit, An Aadhaar Idea Is High On Agenda
content: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer landed in Mumbai yesterday, and among the first people he met was Nandan Nilekani, co-founder of Infosys and chairman of the Unique Identification Authority of India

title: India-UK Trade Pact To Boost MSMEs, Create Jobs: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday said the India-UK free trade pact will boost MSMEs and create jobs, and exuded confidence that the target of doubling bilateral trade will be achieved ahead of the target date of 2030.

title: "Akhilesh Yadav Double-Faced": Mayawati Heaps Praises On Yogi Adityanath
content: Mayawati hailed Chief Minister Adityanath for keeping his promise to maintain parks and memorials built under her government.

title: Top Cop's Suicide Note Details How Caste Discrimination Pushed Him To Edge
content: Haryana's Inspector General of Police and IPS officer Y Puran Kumar, who shot himself dead at his Chandigarh home on Tuesday, left an eight-page suicide note, accusing 10 senior and retired police officers of "blatant caste-based discrimination"

title: German Ambassador Philipp Ackermann To Join Global Leaders At NDTV World Summit 2025
content: The NDTV World Summit 2025, to be held on October 17-18 in New Delhi, will bring together influential voices from across the globe.

title: "Very Shocked": Chief Justice Gavai Breaks Silence On Shoe Attack In Court
content: Chief Justice of India BR Gavai on Thursday described the recent attempted shoe attack on him inside the Supreme Court as a "forgotten chapter," breaking his silence two days after the unprecedented incident.

title: Haryana Man Arrested For Killing Girlfriend In Delhi Over Infidelity Suspicion: Cops
content: A 25-year-old man from Haryana has been arrested for allegedly killing his girlfriend in her rented accommodation in south Delhi, suspecting her of infidelity, police said on Thursday.

title: Intense Search Operation To Find Missing Soldiers In Jammu & Kashmir's Forests
content: Intense searches are underway to trace two missing Army commandos in the forests of Gadol in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag district. Helicopters and drones are part of the search, while ground troops have been combing large parts of the forest

title: US Approves Sale Of AIM-120 Missiles To Pakistan: What It Means For India
content: After sending its first consignment of mineral samples to Washington under a rare earths deal, Pakistan may soon receive the AIM-120 Advanced Medium-Range Air-to-Air Missiles (AMRAAM) from the United States.

title: Elephants Trample 58-Year-Old Man To Death In Chhattisgarh's Korba
content: A 58-year-old mentally challenged man was trampled to death by a herd of wild elephants in Chhattisgarh's Korba district in the wee hours of Thursday, a forest official said.

title: Rare Glimpse From Ranthambore: Mother Tiger Fights Daughter Over Territory
content: Tourists at Ranthambore witnessed a rare and intense wildlife spectacle on Tuesday, when the famous tigress Riddhi (T-124) clashed with her daughter Meera over territory in Zone 3 of the reserve.

title: Toll in firecracker unit explosion in Konaseema district of A.P. goes up to eight
content: Minister assures compensation for bereaved families; three-day ban imposed on manufacturing activities at 18 licensed units to facilitate a safety audit

title: Telangana High Court stays election notification for rural local bodies
content: The Bench, which heard the arguments in the pleas challenging 42% reservations for BC in local bodies for two consecutive days, directed the government to file the counter affidavit in the matter within four weeks

title: ED and IB officials raid Chinese national’s premises in Renigunta
content: According to information, the raid reportedly took place under the suspicion that Du Yongan had heavily defaulted on taxes from his business income

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Madras High Court directs State government to constitute Tamil Nadu Heritage Commission within four weeks
content: Justices R. Suresh Kumar and S. Sounthar issue the direction after finding that the commission had not been constituted even after a year since the TNHC Act came into force

title: Uber expands Intercity Motorhomes pilot to Bengaluru
content: The service allows riders to book custom-designed, caravan-style motorhomes for outstation trips, blending luxury and comfort with long-distance road travel.

title: Andhra Pradesh Excise Minister Kollu Ravindra vows strict action in spurious liquor case at Mulakalacheruvu
content: The government is taking stringent measures to curb production and supply of spurious liquor, he says, adding that all spurious liquor cases during 2019–2024 will be investigated and those responsible prosecuted as per law

title: Dilemma over conduct Telangana rural local body polls continues as HC stays operation of G.O. 9
content: BC Welfare Minister Ponnam Prabhakar said the Government would announce its course of action after receiving the copy of the High Court’s interim orders

title: Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly Speaker Ayyanna Patrudu highlights India’s democratic strength at Commonwealth conference in Barbados
content: The Constitution has laid the foundation for a strong and accountable democratic structure, wherein no institution is above it and people are the real masters, says Ayyanna Patrudu

title: Cyber crime police register FIR against five persons for posting abusive comments on CJI Gavai
content: Bangalore University students submitted a memorandum to Vice-Chancellor Dr. Jayakara S.M., urging that a resolution of condemnation be passed in both the Academic Council and Syndicate meetings of the University regarding the incident.

title: RJD, Congress workers have exposed Rahul Gandhi's campaign against Bihar SIR: BJP
content: Now Rahul Gandhi is sitting abroad amid the Bihar elections as he has turned out to be a flop show even in the eyes of his alliance workers, BJP spokesperson Pradeep Bhandari claimed

title: Ganesh’s story of resilience moves Moyan girls to tears
content: Ganesh Kailas urges the students to never give up, no matter what life throws their way, inspiring them with his own story of resilience

title: Hasanamba Temple opened at Hassan; district administration makes arrangements for devotees to have darshana of the deity
content: Lakhs of devotees are expected to visit the temple during the festival, which concludes on October 23.

title: Four landmines, one mortar shell explode near LoC in Jammu & Kashmir’s Poonch; no casualties
content: “The mortar shell buried underground went off when an earth-mover was digging the land at Sagra village in Mankote area on October 9” the officials said

title: CDSCO calls for list of all cough syrup manufacturers in India, initiates joint audit
content: The regulatory body also also informed the WHO that it has identified three contaminated cough syrups linked to the recent child deaths. It stated that none of the products were exported from India

title: Jan Suraaj Party releases first list of 51 candidates for Bihar Assembly polls
content: Party fields candidates across communities; Prashant Kishor to launch campaign from Raghopur on October 11

title: Kadakampally sues Kerala’s Leader of the Opposition Satheesan for libel
content: Apologise publicly for the offensive remarks, or face criminal prosecution, including a payment of ₹2 crore in compensation for the alleged affront, demands Surendran.

title: Kerala Single Dwelling Place Protection Bill passed in Kerala Assembly
content: The bill protects families from losing homes due to loan defaults. It covers those with a loan amount not exceeding ₹5 lakh, with the government taking over the liability. The total repayment amount should not exceed a maximum of ₹10 lakh.

title: Supreme Court clears way for judicial officers to become District Judges
content: Constitution Bench says seven years’ combined Bar and service experience sufficient under Article 233

title: Hasanamba festival: Helitourism facility launched in Hassan, KSRTC to offer tour packages
content: The heli-ride costs ₹4,300 per person, and the duration of the ride will be around seven to eight minutes.

title: Imperial College London and Science Gallery Bengaluru announce joint fellowship programme, co-development of research facilities
content: The proposed joint initiatives being explored include diversifying and expanding the Science Gallery Bengaluru’s Public Lab Complex, among other things

title: Crack down on illegal resorts in Sathyamangalam Tiger Reserve, Madras High Court tells T.N. govt. officials
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan pass the orders on a PIL petition alleging the operation of as many as 47 illegal resorts and private lodges

title: Two new non-luminous species of fireflies described from the Nilgiris
content: The two species Lamellipalpodes kurumba and Lamellipalpodes debprasama were found in the Nilgiris district in Tamil Nadu

title: T.N. CM Stalin announces launch of co-creation fund to support startups
content: The fund will be managed by the Tamil Nadu Startup and Innovation Mission (StartupTN), Mr. Stalin said; under this scheme, the government will invest in venture capital funds that, in turn, invest in startups based in Tamil Nadu

title: Kannur airport on threshold of transformation as land acquisition and road upgrades gain pace
content: A recent high-level meeting in Thiruvananthapuram decided to assign special officers to expedite land acquisition for the Chorukkala-Bavuparamba-Mayyil-Kololam-Mattanur Airport Link Road.

title: Bihar Assembly elections: Jan Suraaj Party releases first list of 51 candidates
content: Among the names in the list of party candidates, senior JSP leader R.K. Mishra will be contesting from the Darbhanga town Assembly seat, while noted Patna High Court lawyer and JSP member Y.V. Giri will be the party candidate from Manjhi constituency of Saran district

title: T.N. CM Stalin opens 10.1-km G.D. Naidu flyover in Coimbatore city
content: The flyover, constructed at a cost of ₹1,791.23 crore from Goldwins to Uppilipalayam in five years, is claimed to be the longest flyover in south India

title: Thiruvananthapuram Regional Cancer Centre rejects reports of wrong drugs given to patients
content: RCC director clarifies that while there was some confusion due to label mismatch in a consignment of drugs, the issue was detected by pharmacy staff at the time of opening the consignment, and distribution of medicines to patients was stopped

title: Centre seeks action against officials for tribal school built on forest land in Odisha
content: It said that the construction of the school, a flagship initiative of the Tribal Affairs Ministry and the Odisha government, took place "without prior approval", constituting a violation of the Forest Conservation Act

title: Madras High Court relieves retired judge serving as interim administrator of a Siddha medical college for 19 years
content: Justices S.M. Subramaniam and Mohammed Shaffiq say, courts are not expected to run the administration of private institutions for perpetuity

title: Lakhimpur Kheri violence: SC told FIR registered against Ashish Mishra, others for allegedly threatening witness
content: The top court allowed Ashish Mishra to visit Lakhimpur for Diwali, with a directive to return by October 22

title: Will bring Act to ensure every family in Bihar has a member with government job: Tejashwi
content: Announcing it at a press conference, he said the proposed Act will be brought "within 20 days of formation of the new government"

title: Sahara’s plea to sell Aamby Valley, other properties to Adani tentatively set for October 14 Supreme Court hearing
content: Chief Justice B.R. Gavai said a separate Bench of three judges would have to be formed to hear the plea

title: SC to hear AIMIM chief’s plea to extend six-month deadline for registration of waqf on UMEED
content: Supreme Court considers AIMIM chief’s plea for waqf registration extension, highlighting legal implications of unregistered waqfs

title: BSP workers should stand firmly with Akash Anand as they did with me: Mayawati
content: Just as BSP members across the country stood firmly with me during and after Kanshi Ram ji's lifetime, they should now also stand with Akash in every situation and extend their full support, says BSP chief Mayawati

title: Man arrested for derogatory post on VCK chief Thol. Thirumavalavan
content: According to the police, B. Palanivel of Pinnalur had made a derogatory remark against the MP in a video and posted it on his social media handle

title: Nagendran, prime accused in Armstrong murder case, dies of heart attack
content: He had been serving imprisonment for the past 25 years in connection with various criminal cases. In the Armstrong case, he was named Accused No. 1 and was the key conspirator, the police said

title: Kerala Assembly: Three Opposition MLAs suspended on charge of attacking security personnel
content: The suspended Congress legislators are Roji M. John, M. Vincent, and Saneesh Kumar. Tabling government resolution, Parliamentary Affairs Minister M.B. Rajesh says UDF members have ‘crossed the point of no return’ by seriously injuring Watch and Ward personnel

title: Bombay High Court restrains cab operators from using ‘Jio’ trademark
content: The Bombay High Court found prima facie infringement of Reliance’s well-known trademark; domain jiocabs.com remains active despite name change

title: Cough syrup deaths: Two senior drug inspectors in Tamil Nadu suspended, says Health Minister Ma. Subramanian
content: The inspectors failed to conduct quality checks on drugs manufactured by Sresan Pharmaceuticals, whose Coldrif cough syrup is linked to the deaths of several children in Madhya Pradesh

title: Bihar SIR hearing updates: Supreme Court directs Bihar legal service authority to assist excluded voters in filling appeals with EC
content: The Supreme Court asked the Election Commission to provide details of 3.66 lakh voters who were excluded from the final electoral roll prepared after Bihar’s Special Intensive Revision exercise

title: Houseboat boom in Kuttanad spurs Kerala govt to assess vessel capacity of environmentally fragile Vembanad Lake
content: Replying to a calling attention motion, Minister Veena George says Central Water Resources department has flagged that commercial vessels, including speedboats and pleasure cruise boats, in Vembanad were much above the lake’s carrying capacity

title: Bigg Boss Kannada studio back in action after DCM D.K. Shivakumar steps in, filming resumes
content: The studio will be given time to address violations in accordance with the norms set by the Karnataka State Pollution Control Board, Mr. Shivakumar had said in a post on X.

title: PM Modi holds talks with U.K. counterpart Starmer in Mumbai
content: The British PM said the free trade deal is a “launchpad” for two-way growth, with India set to be the third biggest global economy by 2028

title: Mumbai Metro Line-3 becomes completely operational
content: Mumbai Metro Line-3 Phase 2B, connecting Cuffe Parade to Aarey JVLR underground, is now fully operational

title: 458 people dead as Jharkhand witnesses heaviest monsoon in a decade, climate change blamed
content: According to figures compiled from various state departments, 186 people were killed by lightning strikes, while 178 drowned in rain-related incidents. Floods, landslips, and house collapses accounted for the remaining casualties.

title: Goa AAP rules out alliance with Congress over defection concerns
content: The Aam Aadmi Party's comments came after its Goa working president Rajesh Kalangutkar resigned from his post and the outfit on Wednesday

title: Cough syrup deaths: Supreme Court agrees to urgent hearing on PIL seeking probe
content: CJI B.R. Gavai agreed to list the case on October 10 after advocate Vishal Tiwari made an oral mentioning, highlighting the need for judicial intervention

title: Demolition underway of illegal properties in Gandhinagar
content: The police had detained nearly 60 persons for the clash and rioting that occurred in the village. More than 200 people were involved in the rioting, in which several vehicles and shops were damaged and some were set on fire, the police had said.

title: Kerala government announces free travel for cancer patients on KSRTC buses
content: Transport Minister tells Assembly that patients can avail themselves of ticket-free travel by producing certification from oncologist and submitting it to KSRTC bus crew as proof of their medical condition

title: 7-year-old boy dies in fire at private residential school in Kodagu
content: The fire was noticed when students were sleeping inside their room. While several children managed to run to safety with the help of school staff, Pushpak reportedly failed to escape in time and sustained burns.

title: Sri Lankan Navy arrests 30 Indian fishermen from Rameswaram, seizes trawlers
content: Fishermen leaders demand that the Union government immediately speak to the Sri Lankan government and secure their release

title: Kerala Assembly disrupted for fourth day; Opposition stages walkout over Sabarimala gold-plating row
content: As soon as Question Hour commenced, Opposition Leader raised the Sabarimala issue and demanded a public apology from CM over certain remarks made in the House a day ago, which were perceived as body-shaming by Opposition

title: Afghan Foreign Minister Muttaqi arrives in Delhi
content: In January, the Taliban regime described India as an "important" regional and economic power following talks between Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri and Mr. Muttaqi.

title: Supreme Court opens the door for young talents to be appointed District Judges
content: The Bench directs States to reframe their service rules in consultation with the respective High Courts within three months

title: 'Jhund' film actor Priyanshu aka Babu Chhetri murdered by friend after brawl; accused held
content: Sahu and Chhetri travelled by Sahu's motorcycle to an abandoned house in the Jaripatka area for a drinking session. This occurred a few hours before Chhetri was found injured early Wednesday morning, the police said

title: PM Modi welcomes agreement on Trump's peace plan for Gaza
content: "We hope the release of hostages and enhanced humanitarian assistance to the people of Gaza will bring respite to them and pave the way for lasting peace," PM Modi said.

title: Cough syrup deaths: Sresan Pharma owner G. Ranganathan arrested in Chennai
content: Ranganathan’s 2,000 sq ft manufacturing facility located along the Chennai-Bengaluru Highway has been sealed, while his registered office in Kodambakkam remains shut

title: Porsche car crash case exposed systemic corruption: Pune Police Commissioner
content: ‘It also demonstrated how the police, working within the same system, managed to uncover the entire nexus behind the replacement of the juvenile’s blood samples with those of his mother,’ says Amitesh Kumar, Police Commissioner

title: Kerala seeks ₹700-crore package from Centre for tourism development
content: Tourism Minister Mohamed Riyas says Kerala hopes to invite PM Modi to inaugurate a planned wellness conclave and that State government will set a date that does not conflict with the impending local body elections code of conduct

title: Kerala CM leads LDF delegation to Delhi for talks on State’s development
content: Pinarayi to meet Narendra Modi, Amit Shah and Nitin Gadkari. Minister Mohamed Riyas says in Delhi that prime focus of meetings is on forging a consensus between Central and State governments for Kerala’s development

title: U.K. PM’s India visit LIVE: U.K. signs $468 million deal to supply India with missiles
content: Britain signed the £350 million contract to supply the Indian army with UK-manufactured lightweight missiles, deepening weapons and defence partnership

title: Rajnath Singh arrives in Canberra to boost India-Australia defence, strategic ties
content: “We reviewed the full spectrum of India-Australia defence cooperation, including defence industry, cyber defence, maritime security and regional challenges,” Defence Minister Rajnath Singh wrote on X

title: Cough syrup deaths: IMA demands Nadda's intervention, withdrawal of case against pediatrician
content: The IMA President pointed out that the Supreme Court's laid down a proper procedure to be followed prior to arresting a doctor is lacking in this case

title: Bihar Assembly election LIVE: Congress releases 42-page ‘chargesheet’ against Nitish Kumar government; says State polls will have ‘national impact’
content: Jan Suraaj Party released its first list of 51 candidates for the Bihar Assembly elections, but did not confirm whether its founder Prashant Kishor will be contesting the polls.

title: Are workers’ rights being eroded? | Explained
content: What happened at the Sigachi Industries chemical factory in Telangana when a chemical reactor burst? What has the International Labour Organization (ILO) said about industrial accidents? What laws are in place in India that protect workers’ rights?

title: What was behind the ‘I Love Muhammad’ movement? | Explained
content: How did the protests spread to other cities and States? How have Muslim bodies and political parties reacted?

title: State government intends to Tamil Nadu a quality capital: TRB Rajaa
content: Mr. Rajaa said Tamil Nadu has doubled its exports to $52 billion from $26 billion in the last four years, with $14.6 billion coming from electronics.

title: Supreme Court overturns death sentence of Chennai man accused for rape and murder
content: The Chengalpattu Sessions Court sentenced him to death on February 19, 2018, and the Madras High Court upheld it on July 10, 2018

title: India’s invasive aliens problem complicates wait to understand scope
content: Conservation researchers, practitioners, and policymakers in India face a dilemma. As one scientist put it: should they wait to document the effects of all these species to prepare a conservation plan or should they document and conserve in parallel?

title: Trinamool takes fight to Tripura: Delegation visits Agartala party office ‘vandalised by BJP’
content: Delegation stranded at Agartala airport after convoy allegedly held back; West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee accuses ‘double-engine BJP government’ in Tripura of restraining their movement

title: Rakesh Kishore, a septuagenarian lawyer who is ‘unknown’ in legal circle and ‘invisible’ in society
content: He praises the Yogi government’s ‘bulldozer action’ against Muslims in Bareilly, calling it ‘the only way to deliver justice in present times’

title: Tourism takes a hit as the hills of north Bengal reel under the aftermath of floods
content: Hospitality industry members say the tourism industry in the hills lost close to 50 crore in the three days after the floods

title: The Hindu set to host property expo in Singapore on October 11, 12
content: The expo aims to bring together top developers, luxury property brands, and industry experts under one roof

title: Dowdle, Simmons lead Team of the Week 5 in Madden NFL 26
content: totw5's top spots went to Carolina Panthers running back Rico Dowdle and Tennessee Titans defensive tackle Jeffery Simmons . the 90 OVR Limited Edition cards are inspired by the previous week's best real-world performances .

title: Falcons and Bills throwbacks, Commanders' all-black top NFL Week 6 threads
content: the Atlanta Falcons are rocking their throwback uniforms against the Buffalo Bills . the iconic helmet was reintroduced in 2022 with the old school Falcons logo . in the second game of a "Monday Night Football" doubleheader, the Washington Commanders are wearing their all-black alternates against a Chicago Bears game .

title: UWCL talking points: Dumornay in world-class conversation?
content: arsenal lost 2-1 to OL Lyonnes in the UEFA Women's Champions League . the top three spots are occupied by Barcelona, Atlético and real madrid . manchester united were the only women's super league team to win all three points .

title: Natalia Bryant credited as creative director for Lakers' preseason hype video
content: the los Angeles lakers turned to a familiar face to be the creative director of their preseason hype video . Natalia Bryant had a star-studded cast for the "Forever Iconic: Purple and Gold Always" video with los Angeles Dodgers star Shohei Ohtani . actor and noted lakers fan Brenda Song also made an appearance .

title: At 66, John Calipari is innovating off the court, too
content: a reserve walk-on named Lawson Blake tore an Achilles while working out . calipari took over in the spring of 2024 . he was struck with a thought . "what if we had just given him a million dollars and then he got injured"

title: Reevaluating bold predictions for all 32 teams: What has been right, wrong?
content: in the preseason, I made one bold prediction for every team as part of our preview of the 2025 season . it's time to revisit those predictions and find out how we are doing . in some cases, five weeks means everything has changed, in others not so much .

title: Jays knock out Yankees, reach 1st ALCS since '16
content: the blue Jays defeat the Yankees in four games and advance to their first ALCS since 2016 . 5-2 victory in game 4 of the division series and the opportunity to deliver Toronto its first world Series berth in more than three decades . the Blue Jays used eight pitchers in Game 4 to stifle a Yankees lineup that led Major League Baseball in runs scored this season .

title: The 2000 Sooners and 19 other unlikely champions
content: the Longhorns are two possessions away from being undefeated and harps on limiting their balanced attack of arch Manning and Quintrevion Wisner . the Sooners had gone just 44-45-3 over the previous eight seasons, handcuffed first by NCAA sanctions and then by two poor head coaching hires . but second-year head coach Bob Stoops led them to a decent 7-5 campaign in 1999, and with quarterback Josh Heupel slinging the ball around more than 35 times

title: Rescheduled flag-off ceremony of MVD vehicles to be held on October 10

title: Of love and linebackers: The challenges of a college football Saturday wedding
content: the three pillars of autumn in America are the colors of fall foliage, the traditional colors of college football allegiance, bridesmaids dresses, bow ties and bridal gowns . the sun will rise and set on October Saturdays, those days shall be packed with the shifting hues of the trees aroud .

title: Joel Embiid and four other big-name players to avoid in drafts
content: Joel Embiid has averaged just 50 games played over nine seasons . he's reached 60 games just four times last season . the 76ers are a dominant fantasy player when healthy . here are five big names to avoid in your drafts .
